sentence: Beacon Roofing Supply, Inc.BECN has declared private offering of $300 million senior notes due 2023 to fund its previously announced acquisition of Roofing Supply Group (RSG).
The offering is subject to market conditions.
On Jul 27, Beacon Roofing entered into an agreement to acquire RSG for approximately $1.1 billion.
The acquisition will help Beacon Roofing to expand its geographic footprint while allowing better product diversification and customer service.
Moreover, the RSG acquisition will further improve the company's earnings per share while leading to a minimum 30 cents increase in adjusted earnings per share for fiscal 2016.

The proceeds from this offering, together with the borrowings under its anticipated new senior secured credit facilities, will be utilized to fund the cash consideration for the RSG acquisition, refinance some of Beacon Roofing's existing indebtedness and repay a few existing debts of RSG.
The company also intends to pay related transaction premiums, fees and expenses of the RSG acquisition from the proceedings.
The deal is expected to close on Oct 1, 2015.The completion of the notes offering is conditioned upon the substantially concurrent consummation of the RSG acquisition.
The notes offering will be made only by means of a private offering memorandum.
Notably, Beacon Roofing has significantly expanded its business through strategic acquisitions and diversification of its product offering.

The acquisition of ProCoat Systems in Jun 2015 will enable Beacon Roofing to widen its product portfolio across the commercial and residential building materials markets to better serve its customers, thereby aiding long-term growth.
For fiscal 2015, Beacon Roofing expects adjusted earnings per share in the range of $1.30 to $1.35 and adjusted EBITDA in the band of $161 million to $165 million.
The company remains optimistic about its fourth-quarter performance.
Beacon Roofing's July sales picked up, ending with total growth of approximately 9% and organic growth of approximately 4% compared with the prior year.
Based on this, the company believes fiscal 2015 growth will be in the 7% to 8% range.

Peabody, MA-based Beacon Roofing is one of the major distributors of residential and non-residential roofing materials as well as complementary building products in the U.S. and Canada, with more than 90% of sales coming from the U.S.

Beacon Roofing currently has a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).
Some better-ranked stocks in the broader Retail-Wholesale sector are AGCO Corporation AGCO , The Home Depot, Inc. HD and ACCO Brands Corporation ACCO .
All these carry a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
